The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Bard Manufacturing Company, Inc.; Burnham Holdings, Inc.; Carrier Corporation; Chromalox; Crane; Climate Master, Inc.; Empire Comfort Systems; General Electric Company; Honeywell International Inc.; Hunter Fan Company; Invensys, Inc.; ITT Corporation; Johnson Controls; Lear Siegler; Lennox International Inc.; Lux Products; The Marley-Wylain Company; Nortek Global HVAC, LLC; Sears Holdings; Thomas & Betts Corporation; Trane Residential Systems; Uponor, Inc.; Vaillant Corporation; W. W. Grainger; and  White-Rodgers agreed to jointly pay a total of $625,000 in settlement of allegations the companies failed to meet requirements to collect out of service mercury-added thermostats required by the state Health and Safety Code.
Agency: California Department of Toxic Substances Control
Info Source: https://dtsc.ca.gov/wp-content/uploads/sites/31/2018/01/Mercury_ConsentOrder021016.pdf

Description: Sloan Valve Co. and American Standard entered into an $18 million settlement to resolve class action litigation concerning pressurized flushing mechanisms that could cause toilets to crack or burst explosively. The settlement did not indicate how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was divided evenly between them
Private Litigation Case Title: United Desert Charities et al v. Flushmate et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/506114/flushmate-offers-18m-to-settle-exploding-toilet-class-action
